data.fullContent: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration does not strictly regulate the use of herbs, so one should be careful of how much Eucalyptus they use and watch very carefully for side effects. Negative effects include skin rash, worsening of asthma and a lowering of blood sugar levels. Eucalyptus should never be ingested orally because it can lead to nausea, internal bleeding, seizures and even death. Pregnant and breastfeeding women should also avoid contact with eucalyptus because of its toxicity.
data.answer: 美国食品和药物管理局并没有严格控制草药的使用，所以人们应该注意他们使用多少桉树，并仔细观察副作用。负面影响包括皮疹、哮喘恶化和血糖水平下降。桉树绝对不能口服，因为它会导致恶心、内出血、癫痫甚至死亡。孕妇和哺乳期妇女也应避免接触桉树，因为它有毒性。
